name: Audio recorder
description:
This algorithm records WAV files to the MicroSD card. A typical use for this would be to record the module’s inputs, but any bus can be the source for a recording, so you could also record the output of other algorithms – for example, you could run a mixer and record the stereo mix-down.

The algorithm can also play back its recordings. It does so to the same bus channels as are chosen for recording.

Since the module is fully DC-coupled, it can also record and playback CVs.

Up to 10 files can be recorded simultaneously, each mono or stereo. It goes without saying that the more files you record, and the larger the chosen bit depth, the more demands are placed on the MicroSD card. You would be advised to check your card performance before relying on the algorithm for any crucial recordings.
short_description: Records audio to the MicroSD card
use_cases: recording outputs of other algorithms (e.g., mixers)
gui_description:
The display shows a level meter for each file, grayed out if disabled. During recording/playback, it displays the current filename and elapsed time.

When idle, it shows the last completed or played recording name.

During playback, it also shows the current recording’s name and elapsed time.

While recording, a gauge indicates MicroSD card pressure.

specifications.name: Max files
specifications.description: The maximum number of simultaneous files to record is between 1 and 10.

specifications.name: Voltage normalization
specifications.description: Normalization options are 10V or 12V for full-scale voltage in recorded files.

parameters.name: Record lock
parameters.description: If on, changes to the Record parameter are ignored.

parameters.name: Play lock
parameters.description: If on, changes to the Play parameter are ignored.

parameters.name: Bit depth
parameters.description:
Chooses the bit depth for recording. The options are:
16, 24, or 32-bit.

parameters.name: Normalization
parameters.description:
Sets the voltage that corresponds to full-scale in the recorded files. The options are:
10V or 12V. Applies to both recording and playback.

output_ports.name: Left/mono input
output_ports.description: Selects the left or mono channel for recording (per-file setting).

output_ports.name: Right input
output_ports.description: Selects the right channel for recording (per-file setting).
